title: The Economic Machine
content: The economy is like a simple machine but many people don't understand it. It consists of a few simple parts and a lot of simple transactions that satisfy human nature. These transactions are driven by three main forces: productivity growth, the short-term debt cycle, and the long-term debt cycle.

title: Radical Truth and Transparency
content: To be successful, you must embrace reality and deal with it. Pain + Reflection = Progress. Radical truth and radical transparency are essential for meaningful work and meaningful relationships. You need to be open-minded and willing to be wrong. The goal is to find the best answer, not just the one you came up with.

title: The Holy Grail of Investing
content: Diversification is the holy grail of investing. By combining uncorrelated return streams, you can reduce your risk without reducing your expected return. This is how you structure a portfolio that can withstand any economic season (All Weather Portfolio). Do not bet on a single outcome; bet on the balance.

title: Debt Cycles
content: Credit is the most important part of the economy. It allows spending to increase faster than income (short-term debt cycle). Eventually, debts become too large relative to income (long-term debt cycle), leading to deleveraging. Understanding where we are in the cycle is key.

title: The Pain Button
content: When you encounter pain, it is a signal that you have run into reality. Instead of reacting emotionally, view it as a puzzle to solve. Push the 'Pain Button' to reflect. Pain + Reflection = Progress.

title: Idea Meritocracy
content: The best organizations are idea meritocracies, where the best ideas win regardless of who they come from. To achieve this, you need radical candor and a system for believability-weighted decision making.

title: Evolution
content: Evolution is the single greatest force in the universe; it is the only thing that is permanent and it drives everything. Evolve or die. Your goal is to evolve and contribute to evolution.

title: 5-Step Process
content: 1. Have clear goals. 2. Identify and don't tolerate the problems standing in your way. 3. Diagnose the problems to get at their root causes. 4. Design a plan to eliminate the problems. 5. Push through to completion.

title: Cash is Trash
content: In an inflationary environment with money printing, cash is trash. It loses value over time. You want to be in a diversified mix of assets - stocks, gold, commodities - that will appreciate or hold value.

title: Currency Devaluation
content: When governments have too much debt, they print money. This devalues the currency. While nominal asset prices might rise, the real buying power of cash falls. History shows this happens repeatedly.
